alert.note: Alert for Maury; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Maury and southwestern Williamson Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Fairview, or 13 miles west of Franklin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Spring Hill, Thompson`s Station and Leipers Fork. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 51 and 56. Interstate 840 between mile markers 10 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
